Change has been successfully merged
Format issue need to wait https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/obmc-console/+/71164
Hi Marshall, thanks for the change. Can you please add an integration test that demonstrates we've got it correct now? Please see the existing shell scripts for reference.
Sure, we are working on it
We have added log size checking to the log check script.
Can you please add a `Fixes:` tag?
Updated
Hi Marshall, thanks for adding the tests. I have a few comments. Also, can you please update `CHANGELOG.md`?
Updated
Does it need to be this large to exercise the behaviour?
Any log size can be tested, do you have a recommended size?
Probably 1k is enough? I don't really mind though, it's not critical. Maybe pick something that reduces the required math?
Based on the page size, I suggest setting 5K as the minimum log size.

These numbers relate to the magic `256k` and `262144` below. Can you please make it clear (using derivations) how these values are all related?

```
...
BLOCK_SIZE=1024
LOG_MAX_SIZE=$((256 * $BLOCK_SIZE))
...
logsize = $LOG_MAX_SIZE
...
dd if=/dev/zero bs=$BLOCK_SIZE count=$(($LOG_MAX_SIZE / $BLOCK_SIZE)) >> "$TEST_LOG"
...
LOG_SIZE=$(stat -c%s "$TEST_LOG")
if [ "$LOG_SIZE" -ge $LOG_MAX_SIZE ]; then
...
```
Updated as the recommendation.

Note that we're using `set -e`, so this can be simplified quite a bit. I'd write:

We can replace all of
```
LOG_SIZE=$(stat -c%s "$TEST_LOG")
if [ "$LOG_SIZE" -ge 262144 ]; then
  exit 1
fi
```
With

```
[ -e "$TEST_LOG" ] && [ $(stat -c%s "$TEST_LOG") -le $LOG_MAX_SIZE ]
```
Thanks for pointing that out, I learned something new.
See comments on the other test.
Update as the other test script

Ah, so I guess I left what I was asking for a little under-specified.

The form of `Fixes:` tags are described at the bottom of this section of the kernel docs (you may have to scroll down a little bit, look just above "Separate your changes"):

https://docs.kernel.org/process/submitting-patches.html#describe-your-changes

You can see some examples in the git history for the project if you run `git log --grep Fixes:`. A direct example is:

```
commit d659cfcdf6639e2628c982cdf2c3db16649f17b9
Author: Andrew Jeffery <andrew@codeconstruct.com.au>
Date:   Wed Jul 10 09:42:50 2024 +0930

    config: Allow NULL for internal dict pointer
    
    If the default configuration file is not present, behave as if it
    were empty. This allows obmc-console-server to not fail out if no
    configuration is provided, but still fail out if a struct config object
    couldn't be allocated.
    
    Change-Id: Ic188281f5fc41d94b3175c8009c97f1efb62699a
    Fixes: 1e04f449b7f0 ("use iniparser dependency for config file parsing")
    Signed-off-by: Andrew Jeffery <andrew@codeconstruct.com.au>
```

Also note that it's meant to part of the commit message "trailer" (i.e. goes directly above your `Signed-off-by` tag).

Apologies for the late response, and thank you for the example.
I added a fixes tag.
